security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md markdown file. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond documentation. All 32 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the scanner misidentifying documentation code blocks as executable code, and misclassifying Japanese text and YAML frontmatter as cryptographic algorithms and high-entropy content.

content.value_statement: Development quality checks slow down your workflow. This skill performs fast lint, test, and build validation on changed files only, enabling quick pre-commit verification without full project scans.
actual_capabilities: Detects changed files using git status and git diff commands
Runs backend lint checks (Checkstyle, SpotBugs) on modified files only
Executes frontend lint (Biome) and type checking (TypeScript)
Runs targeted tests related to changed code files
Provides formatted success and failure reports
Skips build process for faster execution
limitations: Does not perform full project coverage checks
Designed for frequent checks, not final PR validation

best_practices: Run pre-commit-check before every commit to catch issues early
Use skip_tests=false for normal development to maintain test coverage
Always run qa-check before creating PRs for full validation
anti_patterns: Relying only on pre-commit-check for PR quality validation

faq.question: Which tools are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Gradle-based Java/Kotlin backends with Biome for frontend TypeScript/JavaScript projects.

faq.question: What are the speed differences from qa-check?
faq.answer: Pre-commit-check is 3-5x faster by checking only changed files instead of running full project scans.

faq.question: Can this replace my CI pipeline?
faq.answer: No. Pre-commit-check is for local development only. Always use qa-check or full CI for PR validation.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only runs read-only git commands and executes lint/test tools locally. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why are my tests not running?
faq.answer: Check that skip_tests is not set to true and that test files exist for your changed source files.

faq.question: How is this different from pre-commit hooks?
faq.answer: This skill runs on-demand in your AI assistant rather than automatically on git commit, providing interactive feedback.
